C_to_A.question: What are the two types of capacitors associated with a MOSFET switch and how do they influence circuit performance?

options.A: The two types are gate capacitors and drain-to-source capacitors. Gate capacitors cause charge injection, while drain-to-source capacitors act as parasitic elements affecting switched capacitor values.

E_to_A.question: How does common-mode feedback work in fully differential amplifiers?

options.A: Common-mode feedback (CMFB) in fully differential amplifiers works by using a resistive divider and amplifier to sense and adjust the common-mode output voltage, ensuring it remains stable despite variations in process or temperature.
options.B: Common-mode feedback (CMFB) operates by employing two differential pairs to compare the common-mode output voltage with a reference voltage, then feeding back the error signal to control the common-mode level.
options.C: Common-mode feedback (CMFB) functions by utilizing transistors in the triode region to dynamically adjust the common-mode output voltage, maintaining balance in the differential amplifier.
options.D: Common-mode feedback (CMFB) involves a switched-capacitor circuit to sample and correct the common-mode output voltage, ensuring stability across different operating conditions.
